title: No confidence motion of no use without President’s resignation: Akila
body_lines: The no confidence motion that had been brought against the government will not meet people's expectationas long as President Gotabaya Rajapaksa remains in office, United National Party (UNP) said today.

UNP Assistant Leader Akila Viraj Kariyawasam told a press conference that the President will gain all powers of the government in the event the present Prime Minister and the cabinet is abolished if the no faith motion is approved," he said. The aspirations of those who are protesting at Galle Face will not be met if President gains all power after the no faith motion is approved," he added.

Asked whether UNP leader will accept the invitation made by the President to all parties that represent Parliament for a discussion on forming an interim administration on Friday, Mr. Kariyawasam said he is not aware of the party decision with regard to the matter.

UNP Chairman Vajira Abeywardene said people do not want constitutional reforms at this moment. "All they want is the availability of essential goods and services at affordable prices. What is needed now is a resignation of President, Prime Minister and the cabinet," he said. (Yohan Perera)
